intro: Whitfieldia elongata, commonly known as the slender whitfieldia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
